node.title: Queensland's school start delayed by two weeks as state records 18,000 new COVID-19 cases
node.alt: .Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk speaks at a media conference in Brisbane
node.description: Queensland records 18,000 new cases of COVID-19, with 402 people in hospital, including 22 people in ICU, with five on ventilators.  Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk also announced changes to the return-to-school date for the state's primary and high school students.
node.content:
["Queensland has recorded 18,000 new cases of COVID-19, with 4,320 from people self-reporting rapid test results.\u00a0", "Four hundred and two people are in hospital as a result of the virus, including 22 people in ICU, with five on ventilators.\u00a0", "There are now 80,563 active cases of the virus in Queensland.", "In the last 24 hours, 37,951 tests were done and Queensland's vaccine coverage is 91.1\u00a0per cent for eligible people over the age of 16.\u00a0", "Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk also announced changes to the return to school date for the state's primary and high school students.", "She said projections suggest Queensland would reach the Omicron peak in the last week in January.", "\"Modelling can change [but] the projections are, at the moment, that New South Wales Victoria will reach their peaks before Queensland.", "\"Queensland is expected to reach [our]\u00a0peak during the last week of January and the first week of February,\" she said.", "Ms Palaszczuk\u00a0said it was not desirable to have children back at the peak of the Omicron\u00a0wave and so the government has moved the school year start from January 24 to Monday, February 7.", "However, year 11 and 12 would students will start remote learning from January 31.", "There will be an extension\u00a0to the planned end of school year, with students finishing on December 16, instead of December 9.", "
Hoping 'staffing will be at enough numbers'
", "Education Minister Grace Grace said the government had been \"working on these scenarios for weeks and months\".\u00a0", "\"We want as much certainty as we can possibly provide and we don't want parents having to have snap closures of schools because we don't have staff or because there's an outbreak,\" she said.", "", "
Education Minister Grace\u00a0Grace says the government is hoping staffing will be at enough numbers to provide\u00a0supervision for children of essential workers and vulnerable children.(ABC News)
", "\"It's best that we look at this probably under the best health advice that we can get in the country.", "\"We believe this is the best way going forward to give those parents at least the certainty that they need so they can make arrangements.", "
Mask crackdown
", "Deputy Police Commissioner Steve Gollschewski warned police were going to have to take a tougher stance on masks after officers distributed 324 masks yesterday, more than were handed out during lockdown.", "He said one person was arrested after refusing to wear one and committing other offences.", "\"That is really not good enough,\" Mr Gollschewski said. \"We really need our community to start wearing and carrying their masks at all times.", "\"If we can't see increased compliance with this we're going to have to take a stronger position.\"", "More to come.", "", "
What to do if you're unwell and suspect you have COVID but can't get a test.
"]
